Audio Description: At the top of this poster, in large black block letters and red numbers is the text, “Over 1,000,000 tons of Axis shipping sunk in the North Sea and English Channel.” The bottom portion of the poster is a map. The North Sea and the English Channel are painted a pale blue with the land masses a gray-blue color. The countries of England, Scotland, and Wales are shown in their entirety, while only the coastlines of Norway, Sweden, Denmark, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, and Germany are visible. Black letters superimposed over the landmass identify each country. Along the coastlines are small green, black, orange, and white images representing different types of ships that were sunk, damaged, or captured. A pale blue box in the lower right corner of the poster contains a key to the types of ships represented, including cruisers, destroyers, warships and supply ships. The key also indicates that U-Boat losses are not shown.
